util

analyse_ls.c File Reference

Detailed Description

Allows the user to ‘analyse’ an L-System.

Given an L-System, this program will create some TSPlib files and run Concorde on those files to compute an upper bound. The user can then test this upper bound to predict the running times taken by Concorde to solve them.

The user can also find the average running times and number of branch and bound nodes used by Concorde (for any order of the L-System).

Concorde is run 15 times on each instance when computing the average and standard deviation.

Author:
Farhan Ahammed (faha3615@mail.usyd.edu.au)

Function Documentation

void avg_runtime_bbnodes ( char *  filename,
double *  avg_rt,
double *  sd_rt,
double *  avg_bb,
double *  sd_bb,
int  verbose 
)

Computes the average running times and number of branch and bound nodes used when Concorde solves the given TSPlib file.

Parameters:
filename The filename of the TSPlib for Concorde to solve.
avg_rt The average running time is returned in this parameter.
sd_rt The standard deviation of the population of average runtimes is returned in this parameter.
avg_bb The average running number of branch and bound nodes used is returned in this parameter.
sd_bb The standard deviation of the population of average number of branch and bound nodes used is returned in this parameter.
verbose Set to true (1) to display the running time and the number of branch and bound nodes used for each time Concorde is run.

Creates a TSPlib plot of the specified L-System.

You must delete the individual strings and the array itself when finished with them.

Parameters:
filename The name to give to the TSPlib file.
order The order of the fractal to create.
lsysfile The file containing the L-System to use, to generate the TSPlib files.
lsname The name of the L-System to use.

void createTSPFiles ( char ***  filenames,
int **  numnodes,
int  numInstances,
const char *  lsysfile,
const char *  lsname 
)

Creates NUM_TEST_INSTANCES TSPlib files representing the L-System stored in the given file. The files are created in the current directory. The names of each file are returned in the array filenames.

You must delete the individual strings and the array itself when finished with them.

Parameters:
filenames A pointer to an array of char[]. The names given to each file are stored in this array.
numnodes A pointer to an array of int. The size of each corresponding instance is stored in this array.
numInstances The number of instances to create.
lsysfile The file containing the L-System to use, to generate the TSPlib files.
lsname The name of the L-System to use.

const char *  lsname 
)

Reads the specified L-System from the given file and creates tsplib files of various sizes of the plots represented by the L-System. An upper bound is computed and the user can test it by creating different instances and running Concorde on them.

Parameters:
filename The file containing the L-System.
lsname The L-System to analyse.
